questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of VXLAN? (Choose two)

choices.B: It uses VTEPs to encapsulate and decapsulate frames.
choices.A: It lacks support for host mobility.
choices.C: It allows for up to 16 million VXLAN segments.
choices.D: It extends Layer 2 and Layer 3 overlay networks over a Layer 2 underlay.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
This is correct

Selected Answer: BC
B and C are correct

Selected Answer: BC
B and C are correct.
B and C are correct.

Virtual eXtensible Local Area Network (VXLAN) is a tunneling protocol that tunnels Ethernet (layer 2) traffic over an IP (layer 3) network. Traditional layer 2 networks have issues because of three main reasons: Spanning-tree. Limited amount of VLANs. Large MAC address tables. Spanning-tree blocks any redundant links to avoid loops

The GRE tunnel runs on top of a physical underlay network. With VXLAN, the overlay is a layer 2 Ethernet network. The underlay network is a layer 3 IP network. Another name for the underlay network is a transport network. The underlay network is simple; its only job is to get packets from A to B.

choices.A: R1(config)#interface Gi0/1 R1(config-if)#ip ospf enable R1(contig-if)#ip ospf network broadcast R1(config-if)#no shutdown
choices.C: R1(config)#interface Gi0/1 R1(config-if)#ip ospf 1 area 0 R1(config-if)#no shutdown
choices.B: R1(config)#router ospf 1 R1(config-router)#network 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 area 0 R1(config-router)#no passive-interface Gi0/1

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer configures OSPF and wants to verify the configuration. Which configuration is applied to this device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
See the exhibit. It says "Attached via Interface Enable".

comments.content:
And if that wasn't enough, a little further down it says
"Enabled by interface config"

discussion.content:
C is the correct answer

You can configure ospf two ways, 

Under global config:
router osfp 1
network ip wildcard-mask >> Attached via Network Statement

Under interface:
inter gi0/2#ip ospf 1 area 0 >> Attached via Interface Enable

Selected Answer: C
The interface must be manually enabled so that OSPF could advertise it.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct one because of network advertising.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

comments.content:
Attached via Interface Enable
Enabled by interface config

discussion.content: It can't be A because ip ospf enable is not a legitimate command and also the ospf process number and Area 0 are missing
can anyone explain to me why not option A ? in exhibit it say network type Broadcast

A. 
R1(config)#interface Gi0/1 
R1(config-if)#ip ospf enable 
R1(contig-if)#ip ospf network broadcast 
R1(config-if)#no shutdown

B.
R1(config)#router ospf 1 
R1(config-router)#network 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 area 0 
R1(config-router)#no passive-interface Gi0/1

C. 
R1(config)#interface Gi0/1 
R1(config-if)#ip ospf 1 area 0 
R1(config-if)#no shutdown

D. 
R1(config)#router ospf 1 
R1(config-router)#network 192.168.50.0 0.0.0.255 area 0

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. The "show osfp interface gig0/1" output clearly shows the process is enabled by interface config.

Selected Answer: C
Could go C or D. Since it a interface command. I say C as it refers to interface commands.

Selected Answer: C

Selected Answer: A

Selected Answer: A
The SD-Access fabric control plane node is based on the LISP Map-Server and Map-Resolver functionality combined on the same node. The control plane node’s database tracks all endpoints in the fabric site and associates the endpoints to fabric nodes, decoupling the endpoint IP address or MAC address from the location (closest router) in the network.

Provided answer is correct:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Campus/cisco-sda-design-guide.html#Control_Plane_Node

questions.question_text: What is the function of a control-plane node in a Cisco SD-Access solution?

choices.A: to run a mapping system that manages endpoint to network device relationships
choices.B: to implement policies and communicate with networks outside the fabric
choices.C: to connect external Layer 3 networks to the SD-Access fabric
choices.D: to connect APs and wireless endpoints to the SD-Access fabric

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

if for example you have a VMware installed on windows 10, and this windows 10 in anyway not functional anymore of has some issues. this will affect the VMware and everything running on it

comments.content: I have my vSphere DCV-VCP6 and these questions slay me. This to me is not what CCNP should be about.

discussion.content: it was easy to answer but its crazy how cisco pulls test questions from other websites as opposed to OCG book lol.

Eg: if you use Virtual Box or VMware workstation on top of Windows 10 or 11, when you get the issue in Windows OS, it will impact the hypervisor. (Type-2)
So, B is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: B
Type 2 It is completely dependent on Host Operating System for its operations. While having a base operating system allows better specification of policies, any problem in the base operating system affects the entire system even if the hypervisor running above the base OS is secure.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B, a type 1 hypervisor is on a bare metal server, a type 2 relies on underlying software

Selected Answer: A
correct answer is A

comments.content: Type 2 needs an underlying operating system. So A is wrong

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of a Type 2 hypervisor?

choices.C: Its main task is to manage hardware resources between different operating systems.
choices.B: Problems in the base operating system can affect the entire system.
choices.D: It is completely independent of the operating system.
choices.A: It eliminates the need for an underlying operating system.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a data modeling language?

choices.A: to describe the structure and meaning of exchanged data
choices.B: to standardize the procedures that are executed when parsing sent and received data
choices.C: to establish a framework to process data by using an object-oriented programming approach
choices.D: to specify the rules for transcoding between text and binary data encodings

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think A is correct, not all data models are object oriented so C is wrong

Selected Answer: A
it´s A

Selected Answer: A
meaning of exchanged data

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct one.
C: framework is incorrect

Selected Answer: A
Data models can be implemented using numerous data representation and storage formats, including arrays, linked lists, stacks, and graphs (e.g hierarchical trees). The hierarchical tree is very efficient in representing repetitive and hierarchical data and is typically associated with routing or switching platform configurations. Therefore it is the most common data model format used for networking platforms.
(Source: https://developer.cisco.com/docs/nx-os/#!the-nature-of-data-models)
You are not reading the question correctly, it's asking for the purpose!

Selected Answer: A
Data models enable data to be easily structured, grouped, and replicated to represent information related to network devices, features, and solutions.

from:
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/nx-os/#!the-nature-of-data-models

Selected Answer: A
Data modeling is the process of creating a visual representation of either a whole information system or parts of it to communicate connections between data points and structures
